node.title: Residents assessing the damage after torrential rain in Manawatū
node.description: The clean-up has begun in Manawatū after the second dump of torrential rain within three days left properties damaged, roads and bridges washed out, and nerves frayed.

node.title: Canterbury Bays cut off as torrential rain causes flooding damage
node.description: Torrential rain has left parts of Canterbury cut off after a month's worth of rain fell in one day.

node.title: 'There will never be another bell hooks': Feminist thinker dies aged 69
node.description: Gloria Jean Watkins, known as bell hooks, is remembered for exploring how race, gender, economics and politics intertwined, which helped shape academic and popular debates over the past 40 years.

node.title: Bounce House Disaster Kills 4 Children After Wind Gust Throws Inflatable 30ft in the Air
node.description: The children, aged between 10 and 12, were celebrating their last day of school when a gust of wind suddenly lifted the inflatable into the air.

node.title: 'To lose a son … is one of the most traumatic losses in life', Alex Braes' father tells inquest
node.description: The final day of witness evidence at an inquest into the death of a Broken Hill teenager hears testimony from his father, who says he was "his ray of sunshine, his everything".

node.title: Roxby Downs teenager dies after being hit by jet ski
node.description: A teenage boy has died after being struck by a jet ski in South Australia's Riverland today.

node.title: 'Our economy needs a shot and this is it' - Queenstown mayor
node.description: Queenstown welcomed nearly 2000 Aucklanders yesterday but things are still dire for businesses without international tourism, says mayor Jim Boult. Audio

node.title: Covid-19: Omicron case found in Christchurch MIQ
node.description: The Director-General of Health has confirmed the country's first case of the Omicron variant has been found at a MIQ facility in Christchurch. Watch his media conference live here.

node.title: Māori trusts receive funding to provide 'whare for whānau'
node.description: New papakainga housing is set to be built in Ngāruawāhia to provide safe and affordable homes for local whānau.

node.title: Urban Meyer fired by NFL's Jaguars after ultra-rocky, brief stay
node.description: He didn't even make it through his first season as Jacksonville's head coach. The latest flashpoint was a former Jags kicker accusing Meyer of kicking him during practice.

node.title: How did this happen? Everything we know about the jumping castle tragedy
node.description: It was the final day of school and grade 5 and 6 children were celebrating at a "Big Day In" activity day in Devonport, in Tasmania's north-west.

node.title: Billie Eilish says porn 'destroyed my brain' at age 11, so how can parents prevent this?
node.description: Parents are being urged to have early conversations with their children about pornography, but it could soon become tougher to access it in Australia.

node.title: 20yo linked to COVID cruise and superspreader event fined $10k as Newcastle festival cancelled
node.description: The man was told to isolate, but attended last week's Argyle House event, which has been linked to hundreds of cases. Meanwhile, NSW Health has shut down a music festival planned for this weekend.

node.title: Donald Trump Wants Mitch McConnell Ousted Over 'Unfrastructure' and 'Build Back Worse' Bills
node.description: McConnell and other Republicans had ample reason to assist Democrats in raising the debt ceiling, despite Trump's disapproval.

node.title: NT records no new cases linked to outbreak as Territorians await exposure site details
node.description: The Northern Territory records one new COVID-19 case overnight, a traveller who arrived on a repatriation flight from Johannesburg, as Territorians await an update on key exposure site information after two people who visited Royal Darwin Hospital tested positive on Wednesday.

node.title: Four children die, several critically injured after jumping castle blown into air at school
node.description: Children fell from as high as 10 metres after wind picked up a jumping castle and threw it into the air at an end-of-year activity day at a Tasmanian primary school.

node.title: Residents assessing the damage after torrential rain in Manuwatū
node.description: The clean-up has begun in Manawatū after the second dump of torrential rain within three days left properties damaged, roads and bridges washed out, and nerves frayed.

node.title: Covid-19: 91 new community cases today
node.description: There are 91 new community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today, as the ministry announces changes to the way it reports cases.

node.title: Your Thursday Briefing
node.description: Omicron breaks records in Britain.

node.title: Iran's State-Run Newspaper Threatens Israel With Airstrikes for 'Just One Wrong Move!'
node.description: "Keep your hands off!" the article warned the Israeli government.

node.title: If you've missed these movies in 2021, here's a critic's opinion on whether you should bother
node.description: Zak Hepburn has seen a lot of movies this year. Trust him when he says there are some that just aren't worth watching, but others you should definitely catch.

node.title: UK records highest daily cases amid worry over Omicron spread
node.description: The UK has recorded the highest number of daily Covid-19 cases since the beginning of the pandemic, with 78,610 reported on Wednesday.

node.title: Tensions rise in Masterton's civic centre talks
node.description: A Masterton councillor asked a fellow elected member to watch their tone of voice as tensions rose in civic centre talks on Wednesday.

node.title: Go-ahead for $170m in funding will help people access their health data, Ministry says
node.description: Government approval for health technology funding will soon enable people to check all aspects of their health records using their smartphone or computer.

node.title: Week 15 Predictions: Our Picks Against the Spread
node.description: Kansas City and the Los Angeles Chargers will trade deep shots, Covid-19-depleted teams will do battle for playoff spots and the Patriots and Colts’ throwback matchup should deliver.

node.title: Victoria investigating seven COVID cases linked to possible Omicron exposure
node.description: Genomic sequencing is underway for around 30 COVID-positive people who are suspected to have the Omicron variant of the virus, as Victoria records another 1,622 new infections and nine deaths.

node.title: Underperforming super funds named and shamed by regulator
node.description: Super fund members are being urged to consider switching funds as the regulator warns the industry they need to lift their game on fees and investment performance, with new data showing more funds are failing to stack up.

node.title: Man who kidnapped toddler in 'horrendously misplaced' adoption plot released after time served
node.description: Olando Aleki, 31, is sentenced to three years in jail after pleading guilty to child stealing and entering a dwelling with intent. He is being released from jail after time served, and could now face deportation.

node.title: SA records 24 new COVID-19 cases, including four of the Omicron variant
node.description: South Australia records 24 new cases of COVID-19 as six new close contact exposure sites are identified, including prominent Adelaide CBD restaurants.

node.title: Reserve Bank bond-buying to end in May unless economy falters, Lowe says
node.description: The Reserve Bank governor lays out the options for its stimulus programs next year, with the outcome depending largely on the Omicron outbreak.
